Downtown Tachikawa is served by the JR Chuo line, JR Nambu line, and Tama Monorail.

Showa Kinen Park, located at a former US Air Base, the land was regained as a spacious park.

Subaru of Tachikawa (aka Car Do), one of the largest Subaru dealers featuring large amounts of aftermarket parts as well as used cars. A frequent Subaru-enthusiast tourist stop.
There are several movie theaters and a department store near the station.  These are somewhat busy on weekends.

value: directions=A short (free) bus ride from Tachikawa Station.
content=Bicycle racing takes place on a banked oval track.

directions=30 minutes of bus from Hachioji station
content=Big pools complex with many attractions.
directions=2 minutes walk from Nishi Tachikawa station on the JR Ōme Line, or 15 minutes walk from Tachikawa station.
content=9 outside pools, some with waves.

There are many department stores, Isetan, Takashimaya, Lumine, Granduo, and so on. They all are popular Japanese shopping department stores. Lumine is very popular for teenagers. Takashimaya and Isetan are famous department stores in Japan, so it might have shop clerks who can speak English or other languages. Most department stores have some café or restaurants, so you can rest while shopping..
Granduo (left at exit subway/metro) has good eating area at the 6th and 7th floor.
Sheep, County Clare, Bora Bora, Flow Bar, Daddy's Bar.

value: directions=5 minutes walk on 1st level pedestrian walking bridge.
content=Business hotel with nice staff, many of whom speak English.
alt=東京入国管理局 立川出張所
price=Prices for immigration services are standard across the country.

content=This small immigration branch office can perform various services for foreign residents of Japan.  It doesn't have a full range of services, though, so check the website carefully before heading out.  Unlike some other immigration offices, they speak no English — Japanese is necessary.
